alert.note: Alert for Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 18 at 1:42PM PDT until August 18 at 10:45PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: .Hurricane Hilary will bring widespread impacts to much of the Southwest through early next week. The biggest threat remains flooding from excessive rainfall. While periods of rainfall are possible at anytime over the next 5 days, Sunday night through Monday will be the window where we will have the greatest flooding threat. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central California, including the following area, Mono County. Portions of western Nevada, including the following area, Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of small creaks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Hurricane Hilary is still expected to make landfall in the northern part of the Baja of California or extreme southern portion of coastal California late Sunday. While the system will rapidly weaken, deep moisture will stream into the Desert Southwest. Prolong periods of moderate to locally heavy rainfall will impact much of the area, especially the eastern Sierra and western Nevada. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
